Left thoracoscopy and left thoracotomy.context: Left thoracoscopy and left thoracotomy with declaudication and drainage of lung abscesses, and multiple biopsies of pleura and lung.

Empyema of the left chest.context: Preoperative Diagnoses: Empyema of the left chest and consolidation of the left lung.

consolidation of the left lung.context: Preoperative Diagnoses: Empyema of the left chest and consolidation of the left lung.

lung abscesses of the left upper lobe an.context: Postoperative Diagnoses: Empyema of the left chest, consolidation of the left lung, lung abscesses of the left upper lobe and left lower lobe.

respiratory symptoms.context: The patient has a complex history, which goes back about four months ago when she started having respiratory symptoms and one week ago she was admitted to another hospital with hemoptysis and on her evaluation there which included two CAT scans of chest she was found to have marked consolidation of the left lung with a questionable lung abscess or cavity with hydropneumothorax.

hemoptysis.context: The patient has a complex history, which goes back about four months ago when she started having respiratory symptoms and one week ago she was admitted to another hospital with hemoptysis and on her evaluation there which included two CAT scans of chest she was found to have marked consolidation of the left lung with a questionable lung abscess or cavity with hydropneumothorax.

30-year history of cigarette smoking.context: The patient had a 30-year history of cigarette smoking.

chest tube.context: A chest tube was placed at the other hospital, which produced some brownish fluid that had foul odor, actually what was thought to be a fecal-like odor.

brownish fluid with foul odor.context: A chest tube was placed at the other hospital, which produced some brownish fluid that had foul odor, actually what was thought to be a fecal-like odor.

flexible fiberoptic bronchoscopy.context: The patient had a flexible fiberoptic bronchoscopy that showed no endobronchial lesions, but there was bloody mucous in the left main stem bronchus and this was suctioned out.

bloody mucous in the left main stem bron.context: The patient had a flexible fiberoptic bronchoscopy that showed no endobronchial lesions, but there was bloody mucous in the left main stem bronchus and this was suctioned out.

double lumen tube.context: Following the bronchoscopy, a double lumen tube was placed, but it was not possible to secure the double lumen to the place so we did not proceed with the thoracoscopy on that day.

erythema of the mucosa.context: Today, the double lumen tube was placed and there was some erythema of the mucosa noted in the airways in the bronchi and also remarkably bloody secretions were also noted.

bloody secretions.context: Today, the double lumen tube was placed and there was some erythema of the mucosa noted in the airways in the bronchi and also remarkably bloody secretions were also noted.

temporary obstruction of the left mainst.context: These were suctioned, but it was enough to produce a temporary obstruction of the left mainstem bronchus.

dense consolidation of the entire lung.context: Remarkable findings included a very dense consolidation of the entire lung such that it was very hard and firm throughout.

pockets of purulent material.context: There were many pockets of purulent material, which had a gray-white appearance to it.

whitish fibrotic fibrinous deposit on th.context: There was quite a bit of whitish fibrotic fibrinous deposit on the parietal pleura of the lung especially the upper lobe.

adhesions.context: The adhesions were taken down and they were quite bloody in some areas indicating that the process had been present for some time.

abscess.context: There seemed to be an abscess that was about 3 cm in dimension, all the lateral basilar segment of the lower lobe near the area where the chest tube was placed.

large cavity.context: The most remarkable finding was a large cavity, which was probably about 11 cm in dimension, containing grayish pus and also caseous-like material, it was thought to be perhaps necrotic lung tissue, perhaps a deposit related to tuberculosis in the cavity.

grayish pus.context: The most remarkable finding was a large cavity, which was probably about 11 cm in dimension, containing grayish pus and also caseous-like material, it was thought to be perhaps necrotic lung tissue, perhaps a deposit related to tuberculosis in the cavity.

caseous-like material.context: The most remarkable finding was a large cavity, which was probably about 11 cm in dimension, containing grayish pus and also caseous-like material, it was thought to be perhaps necrotic lung tissue, perhaps a deposit related to tuberculosis in the cavity.

necrotic lung tissue.context: The most remarkable finding was a large cavity, which was probably about 11 cm in dimension, containing grayish pus and also caseous-like material, it was thought to be perhaps necrotic lung tissue, perhaps a deposit related to tuberculosis in the cavity.

deposit related to tuberculosis.context: The most remarkable finding was a large cavity, which was probably about 11 cm in dimension, containing grayish pus and also caseous-like material, it was thought to be perhaps necrotic lung tissue, perhaps a deposit related to tuberculosis in the cavity.

biopsies.context: Many cultures were taken from several areas. The most remarkable finding was a large cavity, which was probably about 11 cm in dimension, containing grayish pus and also caseous-like material, it was thought to be perhaps necrotic lung tissue, perhaps a deposit related to tuberculosis in the cavity.

cultures.context: Many cultures were taken from several areas.

Blake chest tubes.context: Then two #24 Blake chest tubes were placed, one through a stab wound above the incision anteriorly and one below and one in the inferior pleural space and tubes were brought out through stab wounds necked into the skin with 0 silk.

water-seal suction.context: These were later connected to water-seal suction at 40 cm of water with negative pressure.

intercostal nerve blocks.context: Intercostal nerve blocks at probably the fifth, sixth, and seventh intercostal nerves was carried out.

fractured rib.context: The sixth rib had been broken and with retraction the fractured ends were resected and rongeur used to smooth out the end fragments of this rib.

pericostal sutures.context: Metallic clip was passed through the rib to facilitate passage of an intracostal suture, but the bone was partially fractured inferiorly and it was very difficult to get the suture out through the inner cortical table, so that pericostal sutures were used with #1 Vicryl.

Vicryl sutures.context: The chest wall was closed with running #1 Vicryl and then 2-0 Vicryl subcutaneous and staples on the skin.

staples.context: The chest wall was closed with running #1 Vicryl and then 2-0 Vicryl subcutaneous and staples on the skin.
